moves.14... Ne5 15. b3 a6 16. g4: Risky but requires proper play by White.
moves.16... Qc7 17. h3: ? I began to think playing for f4 was better, but it was not. Better was Kg2 followed by h4.
moves.18. Qe3 Nc6 19. Rfd1 Nxd4 20. Qxd4 Qa5: I thought Black would exchange queens but really there was no imperative to do so, in fact, it encouraged overconfidence by White.
moves.21. Bf1 Nd7 22. Qe3 Bc6 23. Kh1: ? A poor plan. Did not foresee Black's strong reply.
moves.23... h5 24. f4 hxg4 25. hxg4 Kg7: Now I realise that Qd4+ is not as effective a threat as I thought. Still, that was probably my best chance.
moves.26. Bg2: Trying to support e4 and defend the diagonal.
moves.26... Reh8+ 27. Kg1 Nf6 28. Qg3 Qc5+: ! Black has seized the initiative and White is in trouble.
moves.30. Nd5: I thought the threats would force an exchange on d5, but...
moves.30... bxc4: !! My almost master opponent shatters those illusions. If Rxc4 or Nxe7, Bb5!
